verses.roman:
rajakaṁ kañcid āyāntaṁ
raṅga-kāraṁ gadāgrajaḥ
dṛṣṭvāyācata vāsāṁsi
dhautāny aty-uttamāni ca

synonyms: rajakam—washerman; kañcit—a certain; āyāntam—approaching; raṅga-kāram—engaged in dyeing; gada-agrajaḥ—Lord Śrī Kṛṣṇa, the elder brother of Gada; dṛṣṭvā—seeing; ayācata—requested; vāsāṁsi—garments; dhautāni—cleaned; ati-uttamāni—first class; ca—and.
translation: Seeing a washerman approaching who had been dyeing some clothes, Kṛṣṇa asked him for the finest laundered garments he had.
